data.commitMessage:
Update proto files and related code

Change-Id: I4e385a822225781efcb34938d21443fff6170766
Signed-off-by: Gabor Hosszu <gabor@digitalasset.com>

comments.message: Instead of using StreamSupport, you can change the parameter, so you can call args.stream(). Also, please name this thing, and not embed this into the parameter.
This can be replaced with a method reference. Please check your warnings in your IDE :)
Please format this line (we usually use IntelliJ default formatting). Is this transaction valid? Why don't we throw an error in this case?
I have reformatted it using IntelliJ's formatter,

data.subject: Update proto files and related code

data.commitMessage:
Use Peer API instead of Devops API

The Devops API of Fabric will be deprecated so this commit starts using
Peer API like Fabric's NodeSDK does.

Change-Id: Iff8cafd2d95772512dc271212dce96299aba617a
Signed-off-by: Gabor Hosszu <gabor@digitalasset.com>

comments.message: please remove this from the commit
really could use more detail and rationale in the commit message.

data.subject: Use Peer API instead of Devops API
